thread.title: Chris Coghlan starts in RF for Cubs in Game 2 of NLCS
thread.title_full: Chris Coghlan starts in RF for Cubs in Game 2 of NLCS - Chicago Tribune

author: Mark Gonzales
title: Chris Coghlan starts in RF for Cubs in Game 2 of NLCS
text:
Chris Coghlan's home run off Noah Syndergaard on May 12 evidently went a long way toward earning him a start in Sunday night's Game 2 of the National League Championship Series.
Coghlan will start for the Chicago Cubs in right field in place of Jorge Soler and will bat sixth. Miguel Montero will handle the catching duties with Jake Arrieta on the mound.
Soler went 2-for-3 against Syndergaard in a 6-1 win with Arrieta pitching eight innings of three-hit ball, but Soler looked uncomfortable Saturday night playing in temperatures that dipped into the high 30s. Sunday night's forecast calls for colder weather.
Here are the starting lineups at cold Citi Field:
Cubs
Fowler cf
Schwarber lf
Bryant 3b
Rizzo 1b
Castro 2b
Coghlan rf
Montero c
Baez ss
Arrieta p
Mets
Granderson rf
Wright 3b
Murphy 2b
Cespedes cf
Duda 1b
d'Arnaud c
Conforto lf
Flores ss
Syndergaard p
Privacy Policy Chris Coghlan National League Championship Series Chicago Cubs Jorge Soler Jake Arrieta Miguel Montero
